newsitem.title: GERMANY: GRUNDIG [GRNG.CN] ENLISTS AID OF CONSULTANTS.
newsitem.headline: GRUNDIG [GRNG.CN] ENLISTS AID OF CONSULTANTS.

text.p: Troubled German consumer electronics maker Grundig AG [GRNG.CN] said on Tuesday it had enlisted consultants Roland Berger & Partner GmbH and Britain's Scientific Generics to help it develop a new business concept.
"This is a move to place Grundig's interests and those of its employees at the centre of attention," said supervisory board chairman Christian Schwarz-Schilling in a statement.
Grundig, whose parent company Philips pulled out this month after tiring of funding its massive losses, has said it is seeking a strong international partner.
The company said it would be reviewing all decisions made in the past in cooperation with Philips and influenced by them.
Roland Berger will make recommendations on Grundig's strategic orientation and location policy, and helping it select which business fields can be profitably pursued.

Scientific Generics, which has specialised experience in the electronics industry, will help define the product line within the master concept, focusing on what can be marketed in the shortest time possible. The consultants and the management board will present their results on March 17.
